Class RockPaperScissors

  • java.lang.Object
    • RockPaperScissors

  • public class RockPaperScissors
extends java.lang.Object
    For Q1 part a: This RockPaperScissors class can be used to play a game of Rock, Paper, Scissors against the computer. The winner of the game will be whoever wins 3 rounds first. Each round is decided as per the rules of a game of Rock, Paper, Scissors. If the player enters something other than the three options, the computer wins the round.
    Version:
    (01/02/2022)
    Author:
    (Steven Baker)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String computerChoice()
      For Q1 part f: This method generates a random number between 0 and 2 (inclusive) and uses a switch statement to determine the computer's choice of "rock" (value 0), "paper" (value 1) or "scissors" (value 2).
      java.lang.String findWinner(java.lang.String yourChoice, java.lang.String computerChoice)
      For Q1 part g: This method determines the winner of the round, then either the player's or the computer's score is incremented unless both the player's and the computer's choices are the same.
      void playGame()
      For Q1 part i: This method plays rounds of Rock, Paper, Scissors until either the player or the computer has won three rounds.
      void playRound()
      For Q1 part h: This method prompts the user to type in their choice of 'rock', 'paper' or 'scissors', get their choice and then generate the computer's choice.
      void printPrompt()
      For Q1 part d: This method prints two blank lines and then a prompt.
      java.lang.String userChoice()
      For Q1 part e: This method returns the user's input for a round of the game (i.e., rock, paper or scissors) in lowercase, with any leading and trailing space trimmed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RockPaperScissors

        public RockPaperScissors()
        For Q1 part c: Constructor for objects of the RockPaperScissors class with zero parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • computerChoice

        public java.lang.String computerChoice()
        For Q1 part f: This method generates a random number between 0 and 2 (inclusive) and uses a switch statement to determine the computer's choice of "rock" (value 0), "paper" (value 1) or "scissors" (value 2). The method then returns the computer's choice.
        Returns:
        A String containing what the computer has generated.

      • findWinner

        public java.lang.String findWinner(java.lang.String yourChoice,
                                   java.lang.String computerChoice)
        For Q1 part g: This method determines the winner of the round, then either the player's or the computer's score is incremented unless both the player's and the computer's choices are the same. The string "draw", "you" or "computer".
        Parameters:
        yourChoice - A String containing what the player has inputed.
        computerChoice - A String containing what the computer has generated.
        Returns:
        A String stating which player has won the round.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        For Q1 part i: This method plays rounds of Rock, Paper, Scissors until either the player or the computer has won three rounds. The overall winner is then announced.

      • playRound

        public void playRound()
        For Q1 part h: This method prompts the user to type in their choice of 'rock', 'paper' or 'scissors', get their choice and then generate the computer's choice. The choices of each are then confirmed and the winner of the round is determined. The scores of the game are then updated and the total scores are displayed.

      • printPrompt

        public void printPrompt()
        For Q1 part d: This method prints two blank lines and then a prompt. The user's input will appear on the same line as the prompt.

      • userChoice

        public java.lang.String userChoice()
        For Q1 part e: This method returns the user's input for a round of the game (i.e., rock, paper or scissors) in lowercase, with any leading and trailing space trimmed.
        Returns:
        A String containing what the player has inputted.
